definition: unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: This fiasco was worse than any of them, and seemed interminable.
sentences.chinese: 這最糟糕的八分鐘是似乎是空前絕後的”。

sentences.english: China today exhibits many of the tell-tale signs of a great speculative mania.
sentences.chinese: 今日中國流露出了許多空前絕後的狂熱的蹤跡。

sentences.english: After years of research on the dice issues, with unprecedented and unrepeatable breakthrough.
sentences.chinese: 經多年的研究在骰子的問題上，有了空前絕後的突破。

sentences.english: Paris - A global financial crisis of the current magnitude is unique.
sentences.chinese: 這次全球性金融危機是空前絕後的。

sentences.english: Julius Caesar has been called the most unmatched military general in Roman history.
sentences.chinese: 愷撒大帝被稱爲羅馬歷史上空前絕後的軍事領袖。

definition: to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
standing above the common crowd (idiom); outstanding/excellent and unrivaled
